snippet: Moshe Kahlon, leader of the center-right Kulanu party, is a former Likud minister who broke away from the party in part out of frustration with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
abstract: Both Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu and Isaac Herzog are vying for support in upcoming election from Moshe Kahlon, whose centrist party Kulanu won 10 seats in Parliament.

byline.original: By KAREN ZRAICK and IRIT PAZNER GARSHOWITZ
byline.contributor: Karen Zraick reported from New York, and Irit Pazner Garshowitz from Tel Aviv. Gabby Sobelman contributed reporting from Rehovot, Israel; Carol Sutherland from Jerusalem; and Diaa Hadid from the West Bank.

lead_paragraph: Moshe Kahlon, leader of the center-right Kulanu party, is a former Likud minister who broke away from the party in part out of frustration with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

headline.main: Breakaway Party Leader Stays Mum on Where He’ll Throw Support After Israeli Elections
headline.print_headline: Breakaway Party Leader in Israel Stays Mum on Where He’ll Throw Support
